notes:
Issue #25 Volkswagen Race Touareg 2006 B. Saby/M. Périn

For the first time in its history the Dakar started in Portugal, in the capital city of Lisbon, departing on December 31, 2005. The rally continued for 2,991 competitive miles through Morocco, Mauritania, Mail, Guinea, and finished in Dakar, Senegal on January 15, 2006.

The European specials provided an opportunity for the local drivers to shine. Once in Africa, however, the expected battle between Mitsubishi and Volkswagen started setting up with a clear advantage going to the Japanese brand immediately after entering Mauritania.

Despite not winning any stages, Bruno Saby and Michel Périn finished in a respectable 8th place.

Sources
History of Dakar - RETROSPECTIVE 1979-2007
